intro: Fockea tugelensis, commonly known as the Tugela fockea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms during the cooler months. Fockea tugelensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry conditions.
